page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW
page.content:
The area studied on the following pages is predominantly a flat, fenland district of{north Lincolnshire}which consists of excellent agricultural land ,with little or no industrial use at present or in the recent past.
Present inhabitants of the district come from generations of local stock,with the occasional "outsider" having moved into the area from large nearby towns:such people still commute daily to their jobs in town.There are no families from other ethnic groups living within the area surveyed. The pace of life here is rather slow, a situation which obviously suits the population, as moving out of the area is almost unknown, unless employment necessitates a move.
